definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In the Twelve Maidens in Jinling, Miaoyu is the only nun.
sentences.chinese: 妙玉是金陵十二釵中唯一的出家人。

sentences.english: Monks are wise, they don't worry about money.
sentences.chinese: 出家人是聰明的，因爲他們不在乎身外之物。

sentences.english: While monastics are nourished mentally with Buddha Dharma every day, enjoying real bliss.
sentences.chinese: 出家人每天用佛法滋養內心纔是真正的快樂。

sentences.english: Elder sister, that family at see you.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐，那個出家人在看你呢。

sentences.english: So left-home people, wherever they may be, must sternly guard their precepts.
sentences.chinese: 所以，出家人處處要嚴守戒律。

sentences.english: That was the first he saw a left home person.
sentences.chinese: 那是他第一次看到一個出家人。

sentences.english: Worse still is an evil recluse who is repulsively loathsome to gods and men alike.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，一個邪惡的出家人則爲人神所共同嫌惡。

sentences.english: Instead of chattering on worldly matters, we monastic practitioners ought to discuss only about the Dharma.
sentences.chinese: 修道人不談佛法，而談俗事，這非出家人的本分。

sentences.english: Elder sister, that home by watch you.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐，那個出家人在看你呢。

sentences.english: Almost all the monks and nuns in China renounce the world by themselves, so do I.
sentences.chinese: 中國的出家人幾乎都是自己選擇出家的，我也是這樣。

sentences.english: The truth is, you don't need to shave your head, or sit with crossed legs to meditate.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，你不必削髮盤坐，像出家人似的冥想。

sentences.english: Wudang Taoism is a distinctive characteristic requirements monk Chunghsiao Prudential.
sentences.chinese: 武當道教1個鮮明的特徵是要求出家人忠孝信誠。

definition: to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!
to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
